p: The molecular structure of 3 (Figure 3) shows a planar As 2Fe 2 ring. A hydrogen atom is attached to each arsenic atom, which additionally coordinates to a W(CO) 5 fragment. The W(CO) 5 fragments are tilted by 30° out of the plane of the Fe 2As 2 ring. The Fe−As distances in 3 (As1‐Fe1 2.4728(7) and As1−Fe1′ 2.4787(8) Å) are slightly shorter than the As−Fe distances in 2 (As1‐Fe1 2.5004(5), As2−Fe1 2.4907(5) Å) but slightly longer than the Fe−As distance in 1 (2.4406(8) Å).
